Nvidia's market value drops $279 billion. How much did CEO Jensen Huang lose?Despite the loss on Tuesday, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's wealth has still grown by $51 billion so far this year, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Can't be trigger-happy: Arvind Kejriwal questions CBI arrest while in custodyThe Supreme Court is hearing Arvind Kejriwal's pleas challenging his arrest by the CBI in the liquor policy case and seeking regular bail.
Centre plans Agnipath scheme tweaks, more Agniveers may be retained: SourcesAgnipath scheme: The government is also planning changes to the emoluments and entitlements of the Agniveers.

Shirtless, pleading for life: Last moments of Darshan's fan before murderIn both the images, Renukaswamy is not wearing a shirt, while there are parked trucks in the background. An injury mark can also been seen on his body.

'GOAT' X review: Fans applaud Vijay's performance, but plot draws criticism'GOAT' received mixed reactions from the audience. While Thalapathy Vijay's performance is praised on social media, the film's plot has drawn mixed reviews.
Have you heard of allergy to chocolates?Instead of making everything better, does eating chocolate leave you feeling sick? You might be experiencing an allergic reaction to cocoa.

IC 814 hijack: Who's the terrorist whose body hijackers sought?Among the initial demands of the five IC 814 hijackers was the body of a terrorist who was buried six months earlier. The terrorist whose body they were demanding was Sajjad Afghani, killed in Jammu in June 1999. Who was Afghani?

Kolkata doctor's family claims police tried to suppress case, 'bribe them'The family of the doctor who was raped and murdered at Kolkata hospital accused the West Bengal police of covering up the case by hurriedly cremating her body and attempting to bribe them.

PM meets Singapore's Lawrence Wong, leaders agree to 'boost trade relations'Prime Minister Modi remarked that Singapore is not only a partner nation, but it is an inspiration for every developing country.

Shah Rukh Khan leads 2024 celebrity taxpayer list, Thalapathy Vijay in second placeShah Rukh Khan leads the 2024 list of top celebrity taxpayers with Rs 92 crore, followed by Thalapathy Vijay at Rs 80 crore. Salman Khan and Amitabh Bachchan are also top contributors.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.
Earth receives the first-ever picture of Mercury's South PoleThis latest encounter marks a significant milestone for BepiColombo, providing the first glimpse of Mercury's elusive South Pole.

Justin Trudeau's minority government at risk as ally withdraws supportCanadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau faces a political challenge after the New Democratic Party withdrew its automatic support for his minority government, forcing him to seek new alliances to survive confidence votes.

MS Dhoni's special appearance in Vijay's 'GOAT' sends fans into a frenzyCricketer MS Dhoni's brief appearance in Thalapathy Vijay's film 'GOAT' sent fans into a frenzy. The film released on September 5.

Tainted Uttarakhand official removed after court's 'Chief Minister not king' rapThe appointment of the IFS officer sparked controversy as Rahul is facing a probe by the CBI for his alleged involvement in illegal tree felling and construction in Jim Corbett National Park.

SpaceX gears up for Polaris Dawn launch, aims to break Apollo recordThe mission, which has faced multiple delays, is now set to lift off from Kennedy Space Center's Launch Complex 39A during a four-hour window opening at 3:33 a.m. EDT.

Violence during Kolkata rape-murder protest in Cooch Behar, Trinamool blamedThe incident took place on Wednesday night in Mathabhanga town during the protest, which was organised as part of the 'Reclaim the Night' campaign to demand justice for the 31-year-old trainee doctor in Kolkata's RG Kar Medical College and Hospital.

Asteroid discovered hours before it crashed over the PhilippinesThe asteroid, designated 2024 RW1, was first spotted by astronomers at the Catalina Sky Survey in Arizona, a NASA-funded program dedicated to tracking near-Earth objects.

NEET aspirant hangs self in Rajasthan's Kota, 15th student suicide this yearThis is the 15th suspected case of student suicide so far this year in Kota, known as the country's "coaching hub". Last year, at least 29 cases of alleged student suicide were reported in the Rajasthan city.

Cycling, lunch, sweets: MK Stalin-Rahul Gandhi's camaraderie on full displayTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin and Congress leader Rahul Gandhi showcased their camaraderie on X, with a playful exchange over cycling plans in Chennai and promises of a South Indian lunch.

'GOAT' Movie Review and Release: Multiplex chains skip screening in North IndiaVijay's 'GOAT' Movie Review and Release: Thalapathy Vijay's much-anticipated film 'GOAT,' directed by Venkat Prabhu, released in theaters on September 5 amid much fanfare. The film has done fabulously in advance booking and is set for a record-breaking opening day.

Video: 55-year-old single mother drives auto to earn a living, says 'son fights with me'The elderly woman said that she drives her auto in the evenings and returns home late at night. She is a single mother and receives no support from her son at all.

Actor Pranitha Subhash welcomes second child, blessed with baby boySouth Indian actor Pranitha Subhash has welcomed her second child, a baby boy. Pranitha and her husband, Nitin Raju, are already parents to a baby girl, Arna.

Gracious in defeat, Medvedev calls Sinner 'one of the best' after US Open exitDaniil Medvedev was gracious in defeat as he called Jannik Sinner one of the best players after the former US Open champion suffered an exit in the quarter-final. Sinner advanced to semi-final of the US Open 2024.

Sumit Antil calls recalls sleepless night ahead of Paralympic glory in ParisIndia's Sumit Antil recalls his sleepless night before breaking the Paralympics Javelin Throw Record in Paris. Antil successfully defended his gold with a 70.59m throw.

Sinner eager to face 'good friend' Draper in maiden US Open semis outingJannik Sinner opened up on facing Jake Draper in the US Open semi-final and admitted that the battle against his 'good friend' will be a tough one. Sinner reached his maiden US Open semi-final.

Harvinder, Dharambir shine as India edge close to 25 medalsIndia's medal tally at the Paris Paralympics 2024 edged closer to 25 with Harvinder Singh and Dharambir being the stars of the show on September 4, Wednesday.

Club throw: Dharambir wins gold, Pranav silver in historic 1-2 for India Paralympics: India's Dharambir and Pranav Soorma won the gold and silver medals, respectively, in the men's club throw event on Wednesday in Paris. India took its medals tally to 24 in the quadrennial event. It was the first instance of a 1-2 for India in para-athletics at the Games.

Sheetal Devi cheers for Harvinder Singh in gold-medal campaignParalympics 2024: Armless archer Sheetal Devi was there in the stands cheering for Harvinder Singh in the final of the men's recurve individual event in Paris.

No Messi, Ronaldo in Ballon d'Or nominees list for the first time since 2003There are no Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo on the Ballon d'Or nominees list for the first time since 2003 as the 30 players up for the award released on September 4, Wednesday.

Meet archer Harvinder, an economics scholar, now a Paralympic gold medalistParis Paralympics: Harvinder Singh, an economics scholar and talented Paralympic archer from Kaithal, Haryana, has made history by winning India's first gold medal in archery at the Games.

PM Modi calls India Paralympics star performers, happy after best-ever medals tallyPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his happiness at seeing India achieve their best-medal tally at the Paralympics after reaching 20 in Paris. PM Modi talked to the athletes and commented on their performance.

Harvinder Singh becomes first Indian archer to win Paralympic gold medalHarvinder Singh put on a dominant performance as he became the first Indian archer to win a Paralympics gold medal. Harvinder secured the medal in the final of the Men's Individual Recurve Open on September 4, Wednesday.

Nitesh Kumar rejoices Paralympics gold: National anthem gave me goosebumps Paralympics 2024: Nitesh Kumar opened up on the emotions that he felt after winning the gold medal in badminton in the Men's Singles SL3 event after defeating England's Daniel Bethell.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
